Day 2

Day 1

[Day 1 - Dialogue with USIP Youth Leaders](https://youtu.be/KTuhS1uq0hY)

# Day1

Child-like innocence does not have the taught problems of prejudice and classism

Modern education is important but lacks a moral dimension  - focuses on capitalistic value 

We are all children of humanity regardless of happenstance of birth

“We are all same, exactly same”

Discrimination does not have a proper basis in peace

Surround yourself with people who show you genuine love and compassion - “karuna”

Where we are born or die is not relevant insomuch as we find a compassionate community in which to do the latter

Authoritarian or totalitarian systems “spoil human brains”

People require genuine freedom to think and listen

“The creator made two ears….” And one mouth so we will listen twice as much as we talk.

Compassion and religion are separate entities but can overlap

“Warm- hearted-Ness here [points to chest], it automatically brings peace.”

Fear becomes anger and anger is bad for our health

Without anger the Dalai Lama sleeps very well ❤️

Anger prevents compassion

Happiness and contentment of life depends mostly upon our mindset regardless of circumstances

“We have to learn to live together on this planet”

Democracy is the best and a leader elected through effective democratic elections is the best leader

How do I prevent anger? Investigate the actual cause of aggravating behaviors and remember how short-sited behaviors liken anger harm us and use our intellect to see/choose a wiser path

“We are one the social animals that has more sense”

Four Spiritual Principles for Peace building

1. Belonging
    1. Community
    2. Fellowship
    3. Family
    4. Neighborhood 
    5. Mogee’s “Peace Club” for women
2. Compassion
    1. We need to develop the whole human race through education and communication 
    2. Attempt to demilitarize the world
    3. Tibet uses no weapons against their occupiers only compassion towards the Chinese 
    4. Research into human “warm-heartedness”
    5. Compassion for the environment is also required
    6. More moral education would help the world fight violence. We need to change our thinking
    7. Life starts with mothers’ compassion.
    8. Fundamental thinking of humans is compassionate 
    9. Compassion is the seed of peace. 
    10. Humans built war machines; we can build machines of peace
    11. Not building weapons or military is practical in the. Amount of money it saves

- Knowledge is a power to learn positive feelings and healing.
- Oneness of humanity
- The Dalai Lama feels pity for those who cause great harm not anger.
- Cultivate inner peace to create outer peace in the world
- Honest, compassionate mind is more powerful than a cunning, angry mind and will create a happier life.
- Belief is secondary to “warmheartedness”
